abstract: President Obama spoke to reporters about his plans to introduce legislation in response to the shootings at a Connecticut elementary school. Reporters had a different priority. And their critics, via Twitter, had an immediate response.
snippet: President Obama spoke to reporters about his plans to introduce legislation in response to the shootings at a Connecticut elementary school. Reporters had a different priority. And their critics, via Twitter, had an immediate response.
lead_paragraph: 3:34 p.m. | Updated The harshest judges of those in news media are often others in the news media, and, with the benefit of Twitter, that intrajournalistic watchdog role can be performed simultaneously with the journalism being criticized.

headline.main: At News Conference, Reporters Skip Past Gun Control and Face Instant Criticism
